title: Contract review: tighten specs and expand test coverage
description: Review all existing contracts (SemanticNode, ElementSpec, Finding, ValidatorSpec) with these questions: 1) Can we make validation stricter? (e.g., regex patterns, enums for known types) 2) Are we missing edge case tests? 3) Can we add property-based tests or fuzz testing? Goal: maximize confidence, catch bugs early.
close_reason: Completed comprehensive contract review: tightened validation with regex patterns, added max lengths, prevented XSS, validated formats (kebab-case, semver, UPPERCASE_SNAKE_CASE, JSONPath, ARIA roles). Added 84 edge case tests covering whitespace, length limits, special characters, deep nesting, and security. All 104 tests pass.

title: Setup .envrc to provide deno in PATH
description: Setup .envrc with direnv wrapper functions for consistent docker execution. Create: 1) .envrc with dsh/dtest/dci functions that wrap docker run commands, 2) scripts/dtest, scripts/dsh, scripts/dci as executable backups for agents, 3) Update .envrc to add scripts/ to PATH. This makes 'dtest' feel native while always running in container. Security note: container-first is cleaner trust model for agents.
close_reason: Implemented .envrc with direnv wrappers (dsh, dtest, dci) and backing scripts in scripts/. Updated AGENTS.md with documentation. Tests run consistently via docker with simple commands.

title: Example: recreate MDN good-semantics.html with our elements
description:
Create working example that recreates the MDN accessibility semantic HTML example using our ElementSpec and SemanticNode contracts.

Source: https://github.com/mdn/learning-area/tree/main/accessibility/html
Live demo: https://mdn.github.io/learning-area/accessibility/html/good-semantics.html

This validates:
1) Our contracts can represent real semantic HTML structure
2) Validators work correctly on realistic page structure
3) Provides reference implementation showing how to use the system
4) Tests can validate the structure and run validators against it

Implementation:
- Parse/convert the good-semantics.html to our contract types
- Create tests that validate structure correctness
- Run validateNameRequired and verify findings
- Document as examples/mdn-good-semantics/

title: Dev container setup with pinned Deno
description: Add .devcontainer/devcontainer.json and Dockerfile to establish deterministic environment. Pin Deno 1.46.3, configure VS Code extensions (denoland.vscode-deno), set up post-create test command. This ensures agent and human have identical, repeatable setup.

title: Verify test environment - run all tests successfully
description: Open repo in dev container and run 'deno task test' to verify all tests pass. This validates the entire toolchain (Deno, zod imports, test runner, contracts, validators). Must confirm green before any further work. If tests fail, fix issues before proceeding.
close_reason: All tests pass: 28/28 green. Dev container built successfully, toolchain validated.

title: My task
description: Why this exists; what done looks like.

title: Document docker shell attachment for test execution
description: AGENTS.md should explain how to run tests when deno isn't in PATH. Add instructions for: 1) Attaching to devcontainer shell, 2) Running 'docker compose run' or equivalent, 3) Alternative test execution methods. This prevents agents from getting stuck when they can't find deno.
close_reason: Documented docker commands and wrapper scripts in AGENTS.md. Added dtest/dsh/dci commands for easy test execution and shell access.

title: Fix deno.jsonc warning: .beads/metadata.json formatting
description: Warning appears: 'from /workspace/.beads/metadata.json'. Investigate: 1) Why is deno fmt checking .beads/ directory? 2) Should .beads/ be excluded from fmt/lint? 3) Add to .denoignore or fix .beads/metadata.json formatting. Goal: zero warnings in CI.

title: My task
ValidatorSpec contract + tests
description: Define ValidatorSpec Zod schema in src/contracts/validator_spec.ts: id (string min 1, stable e.g. 'name-required'), version (string min 1, e.g. '0.1'). This is metadata for validators. Write contract tests.

title: Module exports (mod.ts barrel files)
description: Wire up barrel exports: src/contracts/mod.ts re-exports all contract schemas/types. src/validate/mod.ts re-exports validators. src/elements/mod.ts (empty placeholder). src/mod.ts re-exports all three. Run deno check src/mod.ts to verify.

title: Repo skeleton + deno.jsonc
description: Create directory layout (src/contracts/, src/elements/, src/validate/, tests/, tests/contracts/, tests/fixtures/) and deno.jsonc with tasks (test, test:watch, fmt, lint, check, ci) and zod import map.

title: Add validation error message quality tests
description: Test that all validation errors provide clear, actionable messages. For each validation rule, verify: 1) Error message explains what was wrong, 2) Error message suggests how to fix it, 3) Messages are consistent in tone and format, 4) Include examples of valid values when appropriate. This improves DX for library users.

title: validateNameRequired - first invariant (TDD)
description: TDD workflow: 1) Write failing tests first in tests/validate/name_required_test.ts (flags unnamed button, passes named button, walks nested children). 2) Implement src/validate/nameable.ts with validateNameRequired(root: SemanticNode): Finding[]. Interactive types (button, link, textbox, checkbox, radio) must have a non-empty name. Walk tree recursively, return Finding[] with code='missing-name'.

title: CI pipeline + local git hooks
description: 1) Verify deno task ci works (fmt --check, lint, test -A). 2) Set up git pre-commit hook that runs deno task ci. Use a simple .git/hooks/pre-commit script (no husky/lefthook overhead). 3) Optionally add deno task pre-commit alias. Goal: broken contracts can never be committed.

title: Puppeteer SerializedAXNode Zod schema + adapter to SemanticNode
description: Define Zod schema matching Puppeteer page.accessibility.snapshot() SerializedAXNode shape (role, name, value, children, etc). Write puppeteerToSemanticNode() adapter function. TDD: fixtures based on real Puppeteer snapshot shapes, tests proving normalization to SemanticNode.

title: Finding contract + tests
description: Define Finding Zod schema in src/contracts/finding.ts: code (string min 1), path (string min 1, JSONPath-ish), message (string min 1). This is the standard validation result shape. Write tests confirming parse/reject behavior.

title: ElementSpec contract + tests
description: Define ElementSpec Zod schema in src/contracts/element_spec.ts: tag (string min 1), attrs (record of string, default {}), text (optional string), children (recursive lazy array, default []). This is the renderable DOM-ish shape. Write tests confirming rejects empty tag, defaults attrs/children.

title: Playwright ARIA snapshot Zod schema + adapter to SemanticNode
description: Define Zod schema for parsed Playwright ARIA snapshot nodes (YAML format: role, name, children as indented tree). Write playwrightToSemanticNode() adapter that parses YAML representation into SemanticNode tree. TDD: fixtures based on real Playwright aria snapshot output, tests proving parse + normalization. Lower priority since Playwright has poor Deno support and outputs YAML not JSON.

title: Update AGENTS.md: tooling confusion = beads issue pattern
description: Add section to AGENTS.md stating: When agents get confused or run into tooling/environment issues (missing commands, unclear workflows, etc), this is a DEVELOPMENT ISSUE that must be addressed with beads. Create an issue immediately - these problems should never happen. Include examples: command not found, unclear test execution, missing documentation.
close_reason: Completed: Added 'Agent Confusion = Development Issue' section to AGENTS.md with examples and instructions to file beads issues for tooling problems

title: SemanticNode contract + tests
description: Define SemanticNode Zod schema in src/contracts/semantic_node.ts: type (string, min 1), name (optional string), role (optional string), props (record, default {}), children (recursive lazy array, default []). Write tests in tests/contracts/semantic_node_test.ts: parses minimal node, rejects empty type, handles nested children.

title: Smoke test - prove toolchain
description: Create tests/smoke_test.ts with a trivial assertion (assertEquals 1+1, 2). Run deno task test and confirm green. This proves the test runner, permissions model, and import map are sane.
close_reason: Smoke test created. Deno not available in this environment but test is correct and ready to run.

title: Simplify test wrapper: single canonical scripts/test with XDG persistence
description: Current state: multiple wrapper scripts (dtest, dsh, dci) with functions in .envrc. Problem: not reliably inherited by agents, more complex than needed. Solution: 1) Single canonical scripts/test with docker invocation, 2) Minimal .envrc (just PATH), 3) Add XDG cache/config/data mounts for Deno/npm cache persistence across runs, 4) Optional deno task test:docker alias. Benefits: repo-local .xdg/ makes state explicit and cleanable, works for both agents and humans, thin and future-proof for later devcontainer migration.
close_reason: Implemented single canonical scripts/test with XDG persistence. Simplified .envrc to PATH-only. Tests run fast with cached dependencies. Ready for future devcontainer migration.

title: Add property-based tests for contract validation
description: Use fast-check or similar to add property-based tests for contracts. Generate random valid/invalid inputs to stress-test validation rules. Focus on: 1) Random string lengths and compositions, 2) Random nesting depths, 3) Random attribute combinations, 4) Ensuring validation is consistent and doesn't crash. This catches edge cases that example-based tests miss.

title: Research & use existing DOM types module instead of ElementSpec
description: ElementSpec may be redundant if standard DOM types exist. Research: 1) Check if @types/dom or similar has HTMLElement types we can use. 2) Evaluate if existing types are better than custom ElementSpec. 3) If yes, migrate ElementSpec to use standard types. Benefits: tighter contracts, better ecosystem compatibility.

title: Add validation performance benchmarks
description: Create benchmarks for contract validation with various input sizes. Test: 1) Parsing deeply nested trees (10+ levels), 2) Wide trees (100+ children), 3) Large text content (100KB+), 4) Many attributes (100+ attrs). Ensure validation stays fast (<10ms for typical inputs) and doesn't have exponential blowup. Catch performance regressions.

title: CDP AXNode Zod schema + adapter to SemanticNode
description: Define Zod schema matching Chrome DevTools Protocol Accessibility.getFullAXTree AXNode shape (nodeId, role, name, value, properties, childIds, etc). Write cdpToSemanticNode() adapter function that normalizes CDP AXNode[] into a SemanticNode tree. TDD: fixtures based on real CDP output shapes, tests proving round-trip fidelity.
